trans-unit.source: Provides the base class for all <see langword="TextWriter" /> objects used for rendering ASP.NET mobile controls.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter> class and its inherited classes provide services and helper methods for adapters to perform rendering.
trans-unit.target: La <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter> clase y sus clases heredadas proporcionan servicios y métodos auxiliares para los adaptadores realizar la representación.

trans-unit.source: for operating in a hosted environment.
trans-unit.target: para trabajar en un entorno hospedado.

trans-unit.source: Demand value: <see cref="F:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction.InheritanceDemand" />; Permission value: <see cref="F:System.Web.AspNetHostingPermissionLevel.Minimal" />.
trans-unit.target: Valor de la petición: <see cref="F:System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction.InheritanceDemand" />; Valor de permiso: <see cref="F:System.Web.AspNetHostingPermissionLevel.Minimal" />.

trans-unit.source: The base writer object.
An object of <see cref="T:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities" /> class that provides the capability information for the specific device.
Creates a new instance of the specified class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Adapters are usually constructed automatically by ASP.NET and must have a default constructor.
trans-unit.target: Los adaptadores normalmente se crean automáticamente con ASP.NET y deben tener un constructor predeterminado.

trans-unit.source: The URL to add the resource reference to.
(Optional) The MIME type of the content.
Adds a resource reference to the given URL, with the optional MIME type for the specified content.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The unique URL for the file.
The MIME type of the file.
The character set used for the file (usually the same as <see cref="P:System.Web.HttpResponse.Charset" />).
Begins a response file.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The page adapter must call this method before rendering the page, but after calling the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.BeginResponse%2A> method.
trans-unit.target: El adaptador de página debe llamar a este método antes de procesar la página, pero después de llamar a la <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.BeginResponse%2A> método.

trans-unit.source: An exception is raised if the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.BeginFile%2A> method is called more than once.
trans-unit.target: Se produce una excepción si el <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.BeginFile%2A> método se llama más de una vez.

trans-unit.source: this method is called more than once.
Begins a response.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Retrieves the <see cref="T:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities" /> object for the current requesting device.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The <see cref="T:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities" /> object for the current requesting device.
trans-unit.target: La <see cref="T:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities" /> objeto para el dispositivo de la solicitud actual.

trans-unit.source: This property is provided for convenience, and is equivalent to calling the browser using an <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest>, such as `Page.Request.Browser`.
trans-unit.target: Esta propiedad se proporciona por comodidad y es equivalente a llamar el explorador usando una <xref:System.Web.HttpRequest>, como `Page.Request.Browser`.

trans-unit.source: Ends a response file.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Ends a response.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The specified style to use for formatting characters
Begins a block by using the character formatting from a specified style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The style reference.
Begins a block by using the formatting from a given style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.EnterLayout%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.ExitLayout%2A> methods allow a device adapter to emit markup, in order to begin and end a block using the formatting from a given style.
trans-unit.target: El <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.EnterLayout%2A> y <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.ExitLayout%2A> métodos permiten que un adaptador de dispositivo emitir el marcado para comenzar y finalizar un bloque usando el formato de un estilo determinado.

trans-unit.source: The style reference.
Begins a block by using the layout and character formatting from a given style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.EnterStyle%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.ExitStyle%2A> methods allow a device adapter to emit markup, in order to begin and end a block using the character formatting from a given style.
trans-unit.target: El <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.EnterStyle%2A> y <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.ExitStyle%2A> métodos permiten que un adaptador de dispositivo emitir el marcado para comenzar y finalizar un bloque utilizando el formato de un estilo determinado de caracteres.

trans-unit.source: Ends a block that has been using the character formatting from a specified style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The specified style to use for formatting characters.
Ends a block that has been using the character formatting from a specified style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
The specified style to use for formatting characters.
If <c>breakAfter</c> is <see langword="true" />, a break is added after the closing style element.
The first form of the method assumes <c>breakAfter</c> to be <see langword="true" />.
Ends a block that has been using the character formatting from a specified style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Ends a block by using the formatting from a given style.
The style reference.
Ends a block by using the formatting from a given style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.EnterLayout%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.ExitLayout%2A> methods allow a device adapter to emit markup, in order to begin and end a block by using the formatting from a given style.
trans-unit.target: El <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.EnterLayout%2A> y <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.ExitLayout%2A> métodos permiten a un adaptador de dispositivo emitir el marcado para comenzar y finalizar un bloque usando el formato de un estilo determinado.

trans-unit.source: The style reference.
If <c>breakAfter</c> is true, a break is added after the closing style element.
The first form of the method assumes <c>breakAfter</c> to be <see langword="true" />.
Ends a block by using the formatting from a given style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.EnterLayout%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.ExitLayout%2A> methods allow a device adapter to emit markup, in order to begin and end a block by using the formatting from a given style.
trans-unit.target: El <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.EnterLayout%2A> y <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.ExitLayout%2A> métodos permiten a un adaptador de dispositivo emitir el marcado para comenzar y finalizar un bloque usando el formato de un estilo determinado.

trans-unit.source: The style reference.
Ends a block that has been using the layout and character formatting from a given style.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
This overload of <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.ExitStyle%2A> adds a break after the closing style element.
trans-unit.target: Esta sobrecarga de <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter.ExitStyle%2A> agrega un salto después del cierre de elemento de estilo.

trans-unit.source: Gets a value indicating whether multipart writing is supported.
Default is <see langword="false" />.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
<see langword="true" /> if multipart writing is supported; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
trans-unit.target: <see langword="true" /> si se admite la escritura de varias partes; de lo contrario, <see langword="false" />.
